google_play_reviews.content: I'm not gonna pretend I'm an expert in gps protocols, because I'm not. but i can say it forwards gps data to my servers just fine, and i use it for location logging. App is very simple to use, and you can do whatever you want with the data received at the server side. Very cool and practical at the same time.

Best app ever! Interface is lightweight and practical, so is the application itself. I was building a GPS-driven project and it helped me a lot for parsing, locating and other stuff. Thanks for building this!!!

Works for me too, in combination with a Signal K server running on a laptop, listening on a UDP port. Power consumption of this app seems to be low, which is nice. It would be interesting to add some more features though, like: 1. setting the transmit interval in seconds 2. possibility to configure the required precision of GPS coordinates 3. toggle switch if message should be sent always, or only if position is different from the last one
Works like a charm:) I stream location directly to OpenCPN! Interface is harsh as hell, but does the job! Thank you:)
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Thank you! Sorry for the slow reply, I haven't been monitoring the reviews. Is there any specific user interface change you'd like to see? Let me know if you had any issues finding your way through the app :)

You can also report issues through its GitHub page: https://github.com/tiagoshibata/Android-GPSd-Client/issues
